CS 50: Software Design and Implementation (Winter 2026)

  • Syllabus
  • Schedule
  • Style Guide
  • Resources
  • Knowledge Base

Welcome!

In this course you will learn how to design and build large software systems. You'll learn how to use the Linux operating system and software development tools, how to program in the shell and in C, and learn how to craft software that is understandable, efficient, testable, reliable, and secure.

Please see the syllabus for class details.

Instructors


Katherine (Kate) Salesin

Office hours: Tues and Thurs, 1 to 3 pm | ECSC 014

See Canvas for the full office hours schedule.

Learning Fellows

Winnie Waiya, Arnav Singh, Lorenzo Cuellar, Vishal Powell, and Olivia Cong

Class Meetings

This class meets during the 3A period, Mondays and Wednesdays from 3:30 to 5:20 pm in ECSC 008.

The x-hour for this class is Mondays from 5:30 to 6:20. I do not plan to regularly use the x-hour except to make up for lost class time due to MLK Day and other unexpected scenarios.

Acknowledgements

The materials used in this course are derived from those designed by Professors Balkcom, Campbell, Hauser, Kotz, Palmer, Zhou, and others.

Special thank you to former CS 50 TA Jonah Bard for developing the interactive knowledge base we will use this term!
